item.title: How to automatically validate a model with MVC filter and Fluent Validation package
item.description: I have had the opportunity to see many MVC projects and in the vast majority of them I find structures where the view models are manually validated in all the methods of all the controllers. At best, the code relies on verifying ModelState property from Controller class, but in the worst case… better not to comment it. So, it exists a more elegant solution for this… let’s see it

item.title: How to read User Claims from Automapper Value Resolver
item.description: Sometimes we need to send to our services DTOs that include existing data in the user’s claims. To avoid fattening controllers, let’s see how to make Automapper do this work for us. In our example, we will try to create a company and only receive the name and description, but obviously, we are interested in knowing which user has made this action. The model that exposes the API is CreateCompany and the DTO that we send to the service is CreateCompanyDto.
